npcs.name: Adrianna
utterances: Hello there!  Can I interest you in any wares for your travels?

npcs.name: Aerinleaf
utterances: Don't worry, friend, if it's not on our lists then the goods do not exist.
Here is what the city has to offer, my friend. If you have any questions at all about the stock, please don't hesitate to ask.

npcs.name: Alexander Kerr
utterances: Welcome to my humble shop.  We have quite a selection of weapons to choose from.  See for yourself...
Is there something you need to have custom made?  I can see if I can get one of my lads to look into it!

npcs.name: Aliindar
utterances: Greetings and salutations, my fair patron.  So, what is it within the confines of majestic Qeynos that I may provide for you?
The Ironforge Exchange?  The Far Seas Trading Company?  Insects of industry, my friend, waiting to be crushed beneath my boot heel!

npcs.name: Alissa Cleeway
utterances: Browse the docks all you want, I guarantee you won't find better fish than mine.

npcs.name: Angelia Clayton
utterances: Hello to you!  If you enjoy my dancing please be sure to leave a tip on the counter!

npcs.name: Arbuthnot Jumroller
utterances: Well, then, what can I do for you?

npcs.name: an archery instructor
utterances: Many of our finest rangers have gotten there training here at Elddar Grove.
Elddar Grove has been a great training ground for all our new recruits.

npcs.name: an arena champion
utterances: To be a champion, you first have to think like a champion!
To become the ultimate fighter in the arena, you will have to strive to be the best of the best.

npcs.name: an arena contestant
utterances: I hope you find the day to your liking.
I've seen it all. Now I just want to relax in the comfort of the city.
Oh! You snuck up on me. Good to see you.
I prefer the dark, freshly dug tunnels underground, but I guess this city will do.
I've got a good mind to go in the tavern and never come out.

npcs.name: Ashilda MacHinry
utterances: There is always a way, if desire is coupled with courage.
I'm as nervous as a kerran in a room full of rocking chairs.
Strength and honor will serve you better than gold.
Always be vigilant.  You never know when evil will strike.

npcs.name: an awestruck Qeynos resident
utterances: We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
May the gods continue to bless us.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
Luclin shines so bright...
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.

npcs.name: Barmaid Drinna
utterances: Can I help you?

npcs.name: Bdorn Alehammer
utterances: Hail to ye, <player name>! How might I help ya?
Tis' simple, friend! My following requires me to spread the great word of Brell and to smite th' unclean! Getting a wee bit 'o coin in the process helps pay me' way!
Yup! I trained under the Stonefathers of Brell to start my path of the mysteries of the Lord of Below. One can only get so far in th' trainin' before they're sent out.
Haha! No. To hone yer' priestly craft, one needs to travel to see the world and, Brell willing, to seek out evil and crush it!

npcs.name: Belle Madson
utterances: Aye, drinkin's the life!

npcs.name: Bildi Pieflinger
utterances: Well hello, <player name>! Is there something I can help with?
All stories have a beginning... My beginning was in Baubbleshire! I grew up learning the stories and songs of Misty Thicket and the city of Rivervale.
I left Baubbleshire after I was... *cough* dismissed from the Deepmug Tavern. I assure you, to this day I do not know how that riot started!
What better choice could there be for a halfling lass that travels the roads and byways of Norrath to entertain to earn a bit of coin?

npcs.name: Birney Abbot
utterances: Feel free to browse my wares.
What can I get for ya?
Greetings, always nice to see new faces.

npcs.name: a Bloodsaber assassin
utterances: Get them!

npcs.name: Borden Mannus
utterances: Listen here,  this ain't no public brew hall! The Mermaid's Lure is for Marauders only.
It's one of you! If it wasn't for the Captain's love of this froth, we woulda' run you out of this city just like it was the Age of Turmoil!

npcs.name: Boulden Smitestone
utterances: We can't take any chances that the Rallosian Empire will rebuild itself.  Who will heed my call!?
Now is the time we must band together and find what's left of the Feerrott!
Some call me daft and say that it will never happen.  I wonder how many said the same before the rise of the second Rallosian Empire?

I've sent a few adventurers such as you on expeditions to recover signs that may lead me to the Feerrott, but I've had little luck. That is until I learned of an alliance between the Rallosian army and the Deathfist orcs.
Go to the Orcish Wastes and find artifacts that will lead us to the Feerrott: maps, journals, whatever you can find!
I'm sorry, but you look a bit green for something as momentous as this.  Come and talk to me after you've sunk your teeth into some real adventure.

npcs.name: Breeno Messpie
utterances: I just need enough to tide me over until I need more.

npcs.name: a brightened Qeynos resident
utterances: If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
Luclin shines so bright...
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
May the gods continue to bless us.

npcs.name: Bryson
utterances: Now, if you hope to be as fine an archer as me, you should be off practicing instead of talking to me!

npcs.name: Bungle Proudfoot
utterances: Eh, e... xcuse me? What? Huh? Can I help you? No.. No... Too much to do. Arrrgg!

npcs.name: Buresh
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Captain Gerafaltis
utterances: Good day to you, adventurer.  I hope you have been keeping yourself safe.

npcs.name: Captain Hanstock
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Captain Sellia
utterances: Out on the open sea, you can taste true freedom.  There is nothing like it.

npcs.name: Captain Warland
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Carrik Burnsides
utterances: Idle chat is useless.  If you are not here to train, then leave.

npcs.name: Casiopiea Dorfwife
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: a Castleview resident
utterances: If you don't have any official business in Castleview, please return at another time.

npcs.name: a chi practitioner
utterances: Welcome...welcome traveler, to the fair city of Qeynos! My, isn't it a magnificent day?
Hail, pleasure to meet you.
As a citizen of the mighty city, Qeynos, I greet you openly.
Greetings visitor, I'm glad to meet you.
Those gnolls don't scare me!  Well, maybe just a little.
It is better to swallow your pride than to lose your life.

npcs.name: a Circle of Ten Militia guard
Commander Meldraggelien
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Constable Arathur
utterances: Hail, Qeynosian. Please be on the lookout for any illicit trade activities. We must all do our part to keep corruption from creeping into our fair city.
Some reported seeing such a coin strung about the necks of noble undead who lurk within the dark and dangerous recesses of the Down Below.
Tavern tales claim it's the key to unlocking a secret hive of thieves in the Down Below. What I wouldn't give to gain access to such a place.

You can help the guards repel the flow of illegal libations into this city. Should you ever gain access into the hive, surely there must be evidence of the smugglers and their associates who break our laws.
The Qeynos Guard would pay a great bounty for evidence such as a list detailing what merchants in our fair city deal in illegal trade.  We must punish these Qeynosians for their illicit acts.
Excellent work, Qeynosian! The Qeynos Guard thanks you. Now we may properly fine these merchants for their illegal activities.

npcs.name: Dajor Botswein
utterances: Don't let the pretty waves fool you; life at sea is no holiday, what with serpents, sirens and pirates.
She's beautiful, isn't she?  And deadly.
What?  Oh, no, not her, though she is rather good looking! I mean the sea... she's my mistress, my wife, my love.  Deadly, too, like all women.

Captured young, I was and never will be the same, no matter what happens.  None of us fought back the first time and them pirates moved so quick, by the time we could move they were gone.  If I see them again, I'll protect the ship as I should.  If she means for me to be sliced through by a pirate's blade, aye, then so be it.

Pirates as boarded our ship.  Do you not keep up with the news?  Stole from us they did...but not just from our ship.  Odd things they took, too.  Cap'n thinks they've brought them to Qeynos Harbor, though I think their hideout is further away from the city.  I'm going to get back those stolen trinkets, I am.

Perhaps you can.  Dunno what's going on, but them pirates have been taking spars, sails and lamps off all sorts of old ships.  Like I said, maybe some things are stashed here, but the pirates' hideout is likely out to the Steppes. The Company's put out a reward for finding them, I hear.  We can split it.
I'm having no luck with my search.  How's it going for you?
That's terrific!  I'll just stow that while you keep up the good work!  There's more out there, I'm sure of it.
Found all the missing pieces, you say?  Tell me what you found.

A short spar, a sail and a map, eh?  Very odd collection.  All we're missing is the lamp off the "Far Talon" and then we can claim our reward!  I've heard rumors of pirates being sighted in the Thundering Steppes; perhaps we're getting close to their hideout.
Aye.  I'm sure they won't have that lamp in any obvious location, but it might be hidden someplace where they can easily get to it again.  I'd look along the shores.  Keep an eye out for the pirates!

npcs.name: Dalluk Granitehand
utterances: Ah, hello, there! Come to see the workout regimen of our stalwart bruiser trainees? Look at them have a go! THAT'S RIGHT LADS!  Dodge and counter! Take a hit to give a bigger hit!
Haha! You're not far off! As you can see, we're deep in training here. Being a bruiser requires us to put our bodies through rigorous toughening practices.

What better way to train yourself than to get right into it? Trust me, once you've taken a few square to the jaw, you learn how to take it and stand, or don't take it and fall. There aren't a lot of other choices there!

Not at all! We aren't in this simply to break bones and bruise flesh. This is about using the strength we have to help look out for and protect others. We don't need spears and swords to combat our enemies – we train our fists and bodies as weapons, ready to defend our allies at any moment.

I wouldn't call what we do, "brutality." We use our strength effectively. It's important to cripple or crush an enemy as effectively as possible in any mortal struggle. Along with that is the ability to demoralize an enemy by any means possible. Yes, this is intimidation, but we use it as a tool to protect those who need it.
Hahaha! You can say that it was a bit of an umm... underground operation, if you will.

It's simple! You see, there's a couple of things in Graystone Yard that most everyone liked to do; drink, and fight. And many of us like to do both quite a bit. It's part of the reason you might have a hard time finding an intact, standing table anywhere in the Yard back in the day.

Of course! Well, it seemed that not everyone appreciated the noise that might be generated when these two pastimes are intermingled. In fact, we apparently racked ourselves up a fair amount of complaints from the harbor and from people here in the Elddar Grove.
The city guard began to break up the events, making it so that it was nearly impossible for us to enjoy our favorite pastimes. We were constantly under their watch.

It was! It all stopped for a while, but we got restless. Those of us who found the brawls we had therapeutic began to meet in secret. We decided to try and find a place where we could drink and brawl all we wanted, without the possibility of disturbing our uppity neighbors.

We did. It so happened that the wine cellar under the inn was well insulated, and proved to dampen out the sound sufficiently. The innkeeper was more than happy to have us meet down there, as long as we were careful with the wine barrels, and paid for what we busted.

Well, as I'm sure you could imagine, we ended up spending quite a bit on broken barrels of wine. It was worth it to us, though. After a time, we found that we were getting quite good at our brawling. We began to hold contests, and share technique ideas with one another, which benefited the group as a whole.

Well, as I said, we have always wanted to use our skills to help protect those around us. It was a tough sell, however. The monks here were not impressed with our capabilities, and the guard considered us a nuisance. However, once we were able to gain their respect through our actions, they allowed us to purchase an old building, and set up the Graystone Guild as an official guild within Qeynos.

Well, once the ruckus in the Graystone Yard started, we did what we could to stem the violence, but members of our guild were turning on each other, becoming enraged themselves! We couldn't stay in there any longer, and needed to find a new place to train. The monks were kind enough to let us join with them here, which is quite beneficial for all of our students!
Just one – tell everyone about the Graystone Guild! We want everyone to know we're here, and were ready to help when we're needed!

npcs.name: Danaera Ironheart
utterances: You've got the look of someone new to the city if I ever done seen one!
It can be overwhelmin', 'specially if'n ya come from some place sparser. You'll get used to it in no time, I assure ya!
I've got someone you should speak with. They'll help you settle in 'n feel a bit more at home, I guarantee it!
That they are. Name's Trelly Greenthorn. You'll find 'em in the Elddar Grove section of Qeynos Province District.

It's nothin' to be 'shamed of! In fact, it's rather nice for me to be reminded of the wonder and potential of this city when it is seen through the eyes of someone new. You'll get used to it in no time, I assure ya!
That they are. Name's Patricia Benson. You'll find 'em in the South Qeynos section of Qeynos Capitol District.
Take my advice, you'll settle in 'n feel at home here in no time!
That they are. Name's Mav Boilfist. You'll find 'em in the Qeynos Harbor section of Qeynos Province District.

npcs.name: Daylia the Vigil
utterances: I was wondering when you might come to speak to me.  I welcome you.
I did. Nothing escapes my notice in this city.  I have had my eye on you since you got here.
It is our duty to watch the shadows, to ensure that Qeynos remains safe even from that which lurks where it can't be seen.  When those threats are found, it is our duty to see that it is dealt with.

I am Daylia.  I am the Vigil of the Eye of Bayle, and it is I who directs the actions of our guild.  We have emerged from the shadows to take a more active role in the defense of Qeynos and of the Bayle bloodline.

To give that answer is to give you background on the Eye of Bayle themselves.  You see, the Eye was formed after the sudden death of Antonius Bayle the first.  His passing was unexpected, and there were whispers of an assassination.  Although there was no evidence to prove this to be the case, enough of the court believed it, even if in secret.

They surmised that if indeed there was an assassination, it was unlikely the assassin would ever be caught, and even if they were, the assassination was already done.  They felt that it was best to attempt to head these threats off before they happened.  To wage a war with the shadows in the shadows, to fight them on their ground.

Correct.  We were created to meet these dark threats head on, out of sight from the rest of the world.  We conducted our work in secret, keeping all knowledge of our existence only to ourselves and to select members of the Council.  It was imperative that the populace at large was unaware of our existence, for many would find our methods less than palatable.

We were caught off guard during the attempted kidnapping of Antonia Bayle.  Our order was powerless to stop the attempt, and had it not been for the intervention of others, it's likely that she would have been taken from us.  Our contacts in the Council were not pleased, and we wore the blame for the kidnapping attempt for not having stopped it.

They threatened to disband us, and have us arrested as assassins.  They said that we were no longer a necessary part of the protection of the Bayle line, as others had proven themselves more capable.  We argued that there was no way to prevent what happened, given the nature of the attempt, but there was no give.  They were going to do what they were going to do.

Little did we know, Antonia herself had overheard part of the conversation, and she entered the room.  She demanded an explanation, which we were bound to give.  She was shocked to learn of our existence, and asked question after question trying to learn all that she could.  When we were finished, she dismissed everyone save me.

She told me that she could not protect the order as things were.  As long as we remained hidden, the Councilors could have us dismantled from the inside, and no one would ever miss us – we never existed.  She felt that the Eye of Bayle was a necessary functioning part of Qeynos's security, and did not want to see us disbanded.  Thus, she made a bold decision.

That is correct.  She recognized that there may be some political backlash from the assassins coming forth – the word "assassin" itself conjures up thoughts of villainy and shadowy deeds.  However, nothing could be further from the truth.  We operate under a strict code of behavior, which all of our number are required to adhere to.  We work to protect not only the Queen, but the citizens as well.  We are the first and last line of defense against the shadows.

So that they might know the truth.  We are not hidden any more.  Whether we are honored or hated, we now want it to be for honest reasons.  We will continue to operate in the shadows, but the citizens will know, for good or ill, that we walk among them, ever vigilant in the unseen war.
I have been expecting you, <player name>.
Not much escapes the Eye of Bayle.  It's one of the reasons we are so trusted by Her Majesty.
I do.  Here is the report that Vishra expects.
Hello, <player name>.
I know many things. I have seen your accomplishments and your shortcomings.
Do not be offended. I mean no offense. We all have shortcomings. I must say yours are few  and far between, but to not acknowledge them would be a weakness and I doubt you are weak.
I do. You were sent by Master Gladewalker. I have your mission details but you will need to keep them quiet.

Good. Your task is to crash a secret meeting we have learned about between two factions  of the highwaymen. The meeting is set to take place within the Down Below. The rumor is that there might be a plot against Qeynos and we need to find out what it is.

I know they won't tell you but you have proven your skills in stealth. I want you to  eavesdrop on the meeting and find out the plot. Once you do you will need to deliver my message to the members of the meeting.
Death. They plot against Qeynos and I have permission to get rid of them for good. But  not before you find out the plot so we can act against it.
Good luck, return to me after the meeting and let me know how it went.
Greetings, <player name>. I assume all went well? What information were you able to gather?
We will not stand for this. You must go and track down this assassin. I would start your search in North Qeynos. You will likely need to lean heavily on your tracking skills.
Because that is where I would stay if I were waiting for the Queen to show herself.
You have full authority to take the assassin out. In fact, I encourage it. We do not  want them getting away and attempting this again!
I heard of your heroics. It was quite a battle.

I have eyes everywhere in this city. It is very difficult to hide things from me. Regardless, your heroics are commendable. Please report back to Master Rysian Gladewalker. I will ensure he knows of your heroics. Do you have any questions?
What is it?
What is your request? Is it gold you want? I should have known this was too good to be true.
Saving one life does not make up for the misdeeds of an enemy of Qeynos.
Go on...

That is true. I had not gotten any information on such a plot unfolding within the gates of Qeynos. I will put in a good word with the jury when his time comes to face his punishment. I will make sure he still gets his shot at becoming a citizen, though he may have to start over.
The Eye of Bayle is very proud of your service, <player name>.

npcs.name: Delma Messpie
utterances: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
Be on the lookout, friend!  I just spoke to the guards.  I've no doubt gnolls are scouting the nearby area.

npcs.name: Diggin Diggs
utterances: You're looking a might shabby there.  You look like you can use some repair work.  My partner here, Steelguard, can mend any damaged piece of armor or weapons you might have, all for an outrageously low, low price!  We live for the community!
So, you're a worker with no task, eh?  If you're itchin' to fill your pockets with heavy coin, then I have a task for you.  Are you interested in hunting?
Then prepare for a hunting trip in the Forest Ruins.  I'll pay you handsomely for a bundle of badger pelts.  I may even toss in a bit of Diggs' finest armor.

npcs.name: Dockworker Brond
utterances: Well met! What can I do ye fer?
Egads! You have perfect timin. My hammer was just about on its last leg too! Thanks so  much!

npcs.name: Dockworker Juin'l
utterances: How can I help you?
Um, what?
I am a half elf.
Alright look, joker... I don't have time for this.
[Sigh] Whatever...

npcs.name: Dockworker Kuint
utterances: Oh hello there, adventurer.
Man... Just when the fish started bitin! Now I don't have an excuse to be fishin. Well, I guess it's par for the course. Thanks for the supplies.

npcs.name: Dockworker Quint
utterances: Ello there! Have you seen my quantum capacitor?
Capacitor... You don't know what that is?
Oh, excellent. I hope there is a capacitor in there.

npcs.name: Dortha
utterances: Whoa! Watch your fingers! Some of the livestock haven't eaten all day.
Mounts fuuuur sale! Mounts fuuuur sale!
Down, boy! Down, boy!
Buy today and you'll receive a free feed bag!

npcs.name: a drunk sailor
utterances: Admiral Ravensthorpe left port on the Far Destiny a few days ago. The miserable blighter refused to tell me his ship's destination!

I've heard word of a massive flotilla of ships blocking access to some of the established trade routes! Who do they think they are?! Do the Far Seas Traders have the audacity to think they own the seas?
I've heard the Far Seas Trading Company no longer honors the Pact of Tserrin.
I don't know what to tell you, mate. If the Traders haven't found your brother by now, I'm afraid he's probably gone to the Hold of Prexus.
It's been a long time since we've seen any refugees from the Queen's Colony. Have they all been rescued?
I'm beginning to miss those young adventurers running about town, solving everyone's problems. Good work is hard to find!
Captain Rothwell and his men left port for the Queen's Colony several moons ago. Neither he, nor his ship, the Banshee Wind, has been seen since!

npcs.name: Duvo
utterances: I'm sorry. I cannot help you.
My apologies, friend. I did not see you there ... What is it you need?

npcs.name: Eireneith Alannia
utterances: Now, I'm quite busy ignoring you, so if you'll please move along...

npcs.name: Elderstrike
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Elendia Starleaf
utterances: Good day, fellow ranger!  It is always nice to meet others that chose this rewarding profession.

First and foremost, be in control of the range of any fights you are involved in.  Release a deadly volley of arrows from a distance, and if your foe survives long enough to engage in hand to hand combat, remember that you are also skilled at wielding daggers and swords.

Some of our most effective hand to hand attacks are positional, meaning you need to be behind or beside an opponent for that attack to work.  So you must be aware of situations in which there are multiple foes, and avoid becoming the center of attention, as positional attacks are of little use when you're surrounded!

Last but not least, obtain items that add to your agility or stamina, when you find them!  Agility affects both your ability to inflict damage and avoid taking damage from others.  Your stamina affects your health.  This is crucial.
Hello there, you seek woodlore do you?

npcs.name: an entrance guard
utterances: There is a whole lot of brawling in there. Best not to enter if you don't want to get hurt!
Chaos has taken over Graystone. No one is allowed to enter for your own safety.
It is advised that you do not enter Graystone until the dust has cleared.

npcs.name: Erwin Rohand
utterances: Your kindness is appreciated. These wolf hides are premium wares and will fetch a handsome price.
It won't be too long now, before I can see her again! Thanks again, friend.

Are you looking to help me out? Sailors are always looking for ways to keep warm on the high seas. Wolf hides offer warmth and protection from the bone chilling waters. If you could bring me some sleek hides, the money I make selling them, will bring me closer to finding my love.
Thank you!

npcs.name: Evenwood
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Firus Scorchtouch
utterances: Hello, <player name>. Is there something my greatness may assist?
I seek higher knowledge and to train my skills. Sadly, some of my skills are quite destructive and can not be trained safely indoors.
Indeed you have, and I shall someday be named in the ranks of the very best. As seen by my lineage, I am destined for greatness!
By the bells of Tunaria, how would you of heard of that incident? Let us just drop the subject, shall we?

npcs.name: Flizzle Cogplume
utterances: Well, well, what have we here?

npcs.name: Foorog Gallantblade
utterances: Are you intending to volunteer for service or have you come to speak of more troubles?

Already providing us aid then.  Thank Marr!  Let her know that all able bodied frogloks have been dispatched to assist where needed.  The high elves within Castleview Hamlet have been very accommodating as to tell us where we are needed!

npcs.name: Fosur
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: a freelancer
utterances: Almost time to stop and have an ale, isn't it?

npcs.name: Frup Groaak
utterances: Any of them at all? We were wandering through the vast green lands beyond these walls, when we were set upon by brigands!
Indeed, I should think not. I was very surprised to see other of our kind around here. I and my brothers managed to make our way here from far to the south.
In the depths of the Feerrott. I cannot explain more now - trust is something which must be won, and our home cannot be revealed to those who might wish us harm.
Then perhaps you'll wish to help.
The other I came to these shores with, Giidib, set out from the beach in the opposite direction as I.
I apologize, I do not know the names of places here. T'was quite a ways south east of here, however. There was a great forest situated on the banks above.
Frooooaaaak! Have you seen any of my brothers?
I would like to see Giidib join me here in Qeynos while I plead our case to your illustrious Queen.

npcs.name: Gelerth Bucklebrow
utterances: Hello again, adventurer.
Oh, you betcha! This'll be fun!
Sorry. I am ready for my first lesson.
Bullseye! Nice shot!
<player name>, how good it is to see you again.
I appreciate the offer, however I'm afraid I haven't been completely honest with you.
First, let me tell you that I have come to love this city. You see, I was a refugee and some very nice people took me in and made sure I survived. My parents were killed at sea.

Thank you. But, you see... Those people that took me in were highwaymen. They despise Qeynos. They sent me here to infiltrate the Tunarian Alliance and to lead which ever hero they chose away from their plans.

Like I said at the beginning, I have come to love Qeynos. Everyone here has been so kind. I didn't have a problem carrying out my task until you came along. You went out of your way to teach me. You didn't have to do that. You didn't ask questions, you just took me under your wing and I don't want anything bad to happen to you.
I know about the secret meeting they are sending you to. It's a trap. Once you get inside and make it past their guards they will turn on you and attempt to kill you. You shouldn't go to the meeting.

Yes, but that's okay. I am a member of Qeynos now.This is my home and I need to defend it like any other. I know of a plot the highwaymen are trying to distract you from. They have hired an assassin to make an attempt on Queen Antonia.
Yes, I am prepared for that. In fact, when you leave me now I am going to go and turn myself in to Master Rysian.
I hope so. Regardless, I will take my punishment if it means I can earn my way to becoming a free citizen of the city.

Oh, thank you so much! You are very kind. I know I told you that you shouldn't go to the meeting, but if you do, you should teach them a lesson. There are five of them waiting for you, so be prepared.

npcs.name: a Gigglegibber Goblin Gamblin' Game Vendor
utterances: Buy ticket, you!  Only ten shiny coins! You give just ten shiny coins and maybe you get um... many shinier coins!
Gigglegibber goblins not kill people! War no fun at all.  Gigglegibber goblins like shiny coins and funny things! We like frogs, fluffy kittens, potatoes... You have potatoes?

They tasty! Not funny!... though Gribbik carved funny face in a potato once.  That was funny until he eated it.  Hey! No try to tricks me with talk about potatoes.  You still pays ten shiny coins for ticket!  Buy many tickets! If you buys more maybe you win more than many shiny coins!

npcs.name: Gildas Cedartree
utterances: The varied paths of magic are not for everyone.  Are you here to learn mystical lessons, or can I help you with something else?
Why, thank you! A friend of mine in Qeynos tailored this for me. Perhaps I can see if she has time to make an extra set for you--if you help me with a few favors.

As a Qeynosian wizard, I'm often asked to defend the city with my magical might. Unfortunately, prior commitments require I stay in the city for the next several weeks. If you help with my responsibilities that take me outside the city, I'd be very thankful.

npcs.name: Gild Stonebreaker
utterances: A fine day for a brawl, eh friend?

npcs.name: Gilp Jadefist
utterances: May your path always be clear.

npcs.name: Gimmie Gigglegibber
utterances: Have a gifty good time!

npcs.name: Gornit Penwiggle
utterances: Can't you see I'm busy doing something you can't even begin to fathom?
Looking for my coin? I earned that coin in a grand battle. I was taking on ten of the fiercest and nastiest rats, armed only with me trusty pen and no place to run so I...

Trade, eh? I guess that coin can be passed on for a price, right? I didn't go down into the dark of the Down Below for a coin. Here's a list of items I need from there. Fill my list and the coin is yours.
Grand! Thanks a bunch, but I have some bad news 'bout your coin.
Well, now...I was sitting here shining the little trinket, when a fellow collector snatched it from me. Said he knew the rightful owners and that I oughta' forget all 'bout it.
Sorry, mate. Trade is my life, and if I off and told you his name, I'd never be able to do business at the Collector's Trove again. Wait ... forget I said Collector's Trove will ya?
Ah! Yes, of course ... I need to sign for that quill delivery. Yep! That's all it is. Simple ... legal ... quills.

I agree! But what's a stout to do? My grandparents granted me this atrocious name. They say it was the name of a ferocious giant, a pirate even! Saw it on a journey once, they say. Even spoke to him! Tall tales I say.

npcs.name: Gowan Macgillivray
utterances: Have you the nerve to disturb this mighty Halasian?!
You cannot distract me from my duties!  More impressive individuals than you have tried, and they have failed just like you.  Leave!
Merry Frostfell!
Ahh.  What now?
Oh!  That is very nice of you.
Ah, Merry Frostfell!

npcs.name: a Graystone Guild bruiser
utterances: I've better things to do than hear you cry about society being unfair.
I wish I had the ability to keep the plants in my home happy.
I've heard of you before.  Impressive.  Most impressive.
May your hair, such that it is, never fall out.
I'm not used to this weather, but my people can adapt to any change in order to survive.
I'd invite you to drink some dwarven ale with me, but I don't think you could keep it in.
It's a great day to be alive and be in Qeynos.

npcs.name: Gregor Earthstride
utterances: I can't ever seem to find the arrows I need! Nightbow's shop here is good, but it's a bit pricey.

npcs.name: Grisvane Stonearm
utterances: Hello there.  I'll take care of your coin and goods if they need safekeeping.

npcs.name: Groban
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Gruffin Goldtooth
utterances: Hey there, young 'in.  Don't mind ol' Gruffin.  I'm just inspecting these here mineral veins.  This bedrock is going to be especially useful for building new homes for refugees and citizens alike.

Sure, sure.  I'm always happy to help out a fellow rock hound.  Hmm... I don't recognize this type of stone... and believe me I know my rocks.  It could be described in the books I have back home.  If you would be willing to let me hold on to this for a bit I'll see what I can find out for you.

Great. I'll go check it out right after finishing up work here.  Oh!  I have to collect those rock samples out in the Thundering Steppes!  I forgot all about that!  Could you do me a favor and collect those samples for me while I study this stone of yours?  I'll even pay you some coin for the extra work.

You young people are all so helpful around here.  It's good to see that from the younger generations ya know.  Be careful when you go out to the Steppes.  That place can be mighty dangerous for young adventurers.  Don't going rushin' out there if you are not ready.  Be sure to get enough adventurer experience first.

npcs.name: Guard Delin
utterances: Our Queen sends her greetings!

npcs.name: Guard Kaladenth
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Guard Laelyth
utterances: Tunare's blessings!

npcs.name: Guard Morlo
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Guard Scheln
utterances: Halt!  State your business here.
We are seeking out a fugitive implicated in several acts of rebellious behavior against the Queen.  She must be caught and brought to justice.
What do you know about the woman that was here?  If you have any information, by order of the Qeynos Guard, you must cooperate with our investigation.
Leave that to the Qeynos Guard to decide.  In the meantime, make your way out of here - you're impeding an investigation, and I'll arrest you for further questioning if I need to.

npcs.name: Guard Stonefist
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Guard Tolar
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Guard Valmont
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Hagric Skolvein
utterances: Hello, friend. I am Hagric Skolvein of the Graystone Guild. Have you come here to train with us?

That it is!  It's here we spend time teaching others the techniques we developed and honed, both from fighting each other, and from observation of others who were trained as brawlers. We've all worked together to help perfect our art, and now the Guild, under the direction of Dalluk, is looking to teach others what we've learned.

He is. He is the best of us, without question. It was his idea to start the guild as well, and ultimately through him that we were able to overcome the apathy we were greeted with from those around us.

So, as I'm sure you can imagine, we didn't all always just come here to fight. We had trades and duties, and Dalluk was no exception. He is a merchant by trade, selling and buying items from his contacts in Kelethin. The nightly brawls were his way, as with all of us, of a manner of relaxation. It might sound strange that fighting might be relaxing, but we found that you really get to know others and yourself in a brawl.

Dalluk was far and away the best of us. He seemed to have a sixth sense about fighting, and even when outnumbered three-to-one, he nearly always came out on top, and when he didn't, he would just laugh and say that he clearly hadn't had enough ale. He was able to watch any of us in a fight, and immediately know our weaknesses and how to counter our moves.

It happened that on one of those trips to Faydwer, he came across a young elf mage under attack from aviaks in Butcherblock Mountains. Without hesitation, he jumped into the fray, and began fighting them as he might fight one of us. He claims he remembers little of it, except that once it was over, he was standing, and the aviaks were not. Using the skills we developed here, he was able to defeat armed, deadly creatures.

It was! When he returned, he excitedly relayed the story, and insisted that we could use these skills to help others, just as he had helped the mage back in Faydwer. We were dubious – the residents here were none too pleased with our activities, and the word of a drunken dwarf and a single elven mage wasn't going to change anyone's minds.

Dalluk had an idea. He reckoned that if we were to receive backing from the monks here in Qeynos, our operation could be legitimized and we could become officially recognized within the city. So, with almost the same vigor that he used to confront the aviaks, he made his way to Elddar to speak with the monks.

Not hardly. We were nearly laughed out.  They believed us undisciplined and unfocused, saying that we would be more of a harm than a help to anyone. The worst of the bunch was Sensei Shoda's right hand, Karuda.  He berated our art, and Dalluk in particular. Finally, Dalluk had enough, and challenged him.

Karuda didn't believe it at first, and waved us off. But Dalluk didn't move, and said he wasn't leaving without the fight. Karuda refused, and turned to walk away, but Sensei Shoda was there behind him. He ordered Karuda to honor Dalluk's request, and fight him.

Karuda was furious. He immediately turned and squared off with Dalluk, and both waited for Sensei Shoda to call the start of the fight. After a few tense seconds, the call came to begin, and Karuda immediately attacked Dalluk. I wish I could have slowed time at that moment. Dalluk simply pulled back his fist, waited for the monk to come close, and then, caught Karuda square in the jaw with his fist. It was over in one punch.

He was, but not with us. He said that it was clear that Karuda let his emotions cloud his view, and that he should always take an opponent seriously. The whole exercise was a lesson for Karuda. Sensei Shoda said he saw strength within us, and told Dalluk that he would offer his backing for our guild. With his support, we received our recognition.

npcs.name: Halc Emberstone
utterances: Sorry about my buddy there. He's had a feeeew too many!

npcs.name: Hargrove Leafsway
utterances: I'm sorry citizen, but it is unsafe to enter The Willow Wood just now. A well organized group of gnolls has invaded and we are awaiting reinforcements from the Queen.

npcs.name: Harkam Nubbytoe
utterances: Oh, I was not prepared for these types of injuries. No, no.
Hello, adventurer!  Have we met before?  I usually have a keen eye for faces.
Ah!  Well, I am usually in the castle, so that may explain it.  I see to the wishes of Queen Antonia and her guests.  That's why I'm here.
Yes!  I was sent here to tend to the burns and wounds inflicted upon the Willow Wood citizens, due to the gnoll attack.
As impossible as it may sound, it is true!  Burns and gnoll bites I was prepared for, but this...?!
I am not prepared to deal with void tainted wounds like these!
Yes, the wounded that have escaped the Baubbleshire speak of an attack of nightbloods in there!  I need a strong arcane salve to heal their wounds.
A priest at the Temple of Life should be able to provide you with a strong arcane salve.
Oh, such a relief!  I was starting to worry for you, <player name>.
Thank you greatly!  Apply it to the wounded Baubbleshire defender.
Dear gods!  What was that?!
That didn't help at all!  That only made matters worse!  Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear.
I... I don't know what could have gone so wrong!  That was a contagion agent, not a healing salve.  No Celestial Watch priest would have ever created such a thing knowingly.
Wait.  What medic was this?  Didn't you get this salve from a priest?
That was no medic of the Celestial Watch!  A superior healing salve could only have been made by a priest.  This was a purposeful act!
Around Qeynos, there is only one group capable of carrying out such a heinous act - the Bloodsabers.
If the rumors hold any truth, they are under our very feet.  Seems the decaying catacombs below our fair city serves as both resting ground for our dearly departed and breeding ground for pestilence.
Nothing good, I assure you, <player name>.  I implore you to venture Down Below and find out.  Locate their lair, and put a stop to their damnable plot.
You'll find an entrance to the Down Below along the eastern most wall, here within the Elddar Grove, past the In Range archery shop.
<player name>, you are back!  What did you find of the Bloodsabers?
Were you able to destroy it?
They hold mummified organs, and upon each jar is etched the ancient symbol of the house of Bayle.  Oh, that is not good!

These could only be the canopic jars of Kane Bayle, the traitor.  A secret worshiper of Bertoxxulous and member of the Bloodsabers.  He was put to death due to his involvement with a failed assassination attempt on his brother, Antonius IV.
I don't know.  But I do know that we cannot let them fall into the wrong hands.  I'll have to consult others about them.
Priest Ian Turner stopped by while you were away.  He provided the real Superior Salve of Nife that we needed for the wounded.

And he confirmed that it was a band of Bloodsabers that had attacked him.  He was concerned for you, too!  I will send word to him of your findings in the catacombs, and see what advice he has about the canopic jars you brought back.
Oh, no!  There are more pressing things for you, right now.  I saw a few gnolls run into Elddar Grove from the Willow Wood as some citizens were making their escape.  Find them and remove them!
You're looking a bit scuffed, but you've survived, <player name>!  For that, I am grateful!
No.  They should not have tried to attack our fair city!  Thank you for smiting those ravaging beasts!
Spoken like a true hero.  Ah, while you were away I received a message back from Priest Ian Turner concerning Kane's canopic jars.
We must be careful to properly dispose of them.  If they were disposed of carelessly, it could cause a plague of unimaginable proportions to spread throughout Qeynos!

Very true!  I know that you can be trusted with such a delicate matter, so I'm asking you to deliver it to Baron Kaedrin Ironforge at the Ironforge Exchange.  He has crafted the proper arcane objects to destroy it.
Did you find Baron Kaedrin Ironforge at the Ironforge Exchange?
Oh, that's a relief!  I cringe to think what horrible fate we have averted on this day.  You truly are a hero of Qeynos!
It's such a relief to know that those canopic jars didn't fall into the wrong hands.  In the name of Antonia and Qeynos, thank you for all of your help!
Ah good, there you are.  I've been waiting for you.
Indeed, and I think I know what you're looking for, too!
I do, but I could not follow her myself.  She asked me to tell you that she had escaped safely, and had made her way through the sewers.
There are a lot of places to hide down there.  She'll be safe enough.
Ah yes, the hero until the end, is it?  Very well, make your way into the Down Below.  She didn't leave too long ago.  If you're swift, you can catch her.

npcs.name: Harron Griswald
utterances: Ah now Kara, settle down. They were probably just big Iksar...
If you're looking for the bar, it's upstairs. Be careful of the Coldwind Marauders ... they really enjoy their drink.

npcs.name: Highgold
utterances: Good day to you, citizen! All preserve Queen Antonia.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Hilldon
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Hunter Lathar Forestdeep
utterances: What do you need? I'm very busy.
Yes, yes, that's fine.  I suppose it would be rude of me not to offer you anything in return. It's not much, but it's something.

npcs.name: Ian Cathlan
utterances: I'm sorry. I don't know who ye are.  If ye'd be so kind as ta leave me to my business, I'd appreciate it.  Good day ta ye.

npcs.name: Inim Candychewer
utterances: Hello, my friend. Are you here to learn about Frostfell?

Are you kidding? Frostfell is the most special-est, best-est time of the whole year! It's the most fun you've ever had! Everyone is happy and cheery and everyone loves everyone else! The first day of Frostfell is Kinship Day, and then there is Feasting Day, then the best day of all, Gifting Day and then there's Frostfell Day!
A long time ago, when everyone was sad and hungry, suddenly a lot of happiness and food just showed up at everyone's house. That's where Frostfell comes from.
That's all I care about.
What do you want to know?

Kinship Day is the day devoted to the love of family and friends. Everyone gets together and hugs and tells each other how much they love each other. It is a really beautiful day, all those people being super happy and spending time with each other!
Feasting Day is when everyone gets together and cooks up the best foods you can imagine; Vulrich casserole, manticore surprise, chocolate covered lion tails. It's great!
Gifting Day is easily the best day of all! That's when everyone gives each other gifts! It's so incredibly super. Every year Lord Bowsprite knits us all these great sweaters.

Frostfell Day marks the last day of Frostfell. The day is filled with sincere good byes and well wishes. Everyone sings and dances and there is usually a grand parade. It is the bestest end to any celebration ever!

npcs.name: Initiate Lunaru
utterances: Sorry, I can't speak now.  I must prepare for my sparring exercises.

npcs.name: Initiate Tara
utterances: Tread softly and speak your purpose.

npcs.name: an injured Baubbleshire citizen
utterances: Ugh... it all hurts.  I hope this isn't the end for me...
Oh, thank you!  I feel much better already!

npcs.name: Innkeeper Galsway
utterances: What is it you need, traveler? If it's reasonable rates, fine food and ale you desire, you've come to the right inn.

npcs.name: Investigator Keklem
utterances: I have a lot of work to do, so please be on your way.
Ah look, another adventurer has barged their way into the guard quarters.  Is there something I can do for you?

Oh goodie.  I'm surprised you didn't just solve the problem with your axe or spiked club or whatever it is that you're hauling around.  This might call for a new holiday.  "Adventurers Actually Let Someone Else Do Something For Once Day."  I love the sound of that.
Very well... what is the nature of your report?
Oh?  And how did you come to this conclusion?
I see... that is very interesting.  May I see this note?
Yes yes... this will help our investigation.  You've done a good service for Qeynos.  Please go with our thanks, and tell this... Rinna, was it?  Tell her thank you from us, too.

npcs.name: Jarek O'Kelly
utterances: I just got a shipment in from the Far Sea's Trading Company.  I don't just show anybody this stuff so, shhhh!

npcs.name: Jendan Greenthorn
utterances: Ah Brunn!  I see my sister finally cured you.  I understand, though, that you cured yourself!
Well, hopefully that someone will continue watching your back.  Now, I asked Trelly to have you speak with me about something urgent as soon as you got better.
While I was captured, the gnolls guarding me spoke about another operation in the Forest Ruins.  Apparently this invasion of theirs isn't going as smoothly as they'd hoped.
Exactly.  The bad news, however, is that they're digging a tunnel within the ruined castle with the Capitol District as their target.  I guess this is their "Plan B."
The Qeynos Guard will have to step in here, as I and the rest of us within the Tunarian Alliance are still dealing with the gnolls in The Willow Wood.  They've yet to hear my scouting report.

A Colonel Belaridonis.  He's a high elf who I've worked with in the past.  He's stationed inside the Forest Ruin near the gate.  Relay what I've told you to him.  I warn you, though, even for a high elf he's exceptionally contemptuous of anyone non-Koada'Dal.
Ah <player name>!  I see my sister finally cured you.  I understand, though, that you cured yourself!

npcs.name: Jennis Proudhilt
utterances: Blessings to you <player name>. How may I be of service?
To be a Paladin requires far more than most are able to pay, be that monetarily, physically or spiritually. Coming from a high-ranking family in Qeynos, the cash and the time were easy.
Ah, that is another matter entirely. One must build their soul through tests of courage and piety, to be a perfect weapon for their faith.
I assure you, I am well worth my fee and it shall indeed be paid. The money I acquire though, goes to the faith first and foremost.
I shall defend you with my life... Or until you run out of coin...

npcs.name: Jerben Sleepwell
utterances: It's been so long since I've had one of my wife's special desserts! I want some crunchies! Will you help me get more crunchies?
Hello fellow patron!
Oh, I was just reminiscing about how my lovely wife would bake white batwing crunchies--everyone loved those crunchy treats, but we've run out of albino batwings to make them.

Really? You'd help me, friend? That's wonderful. I've not had the crunchies in so long; I forget what they taste like. You'll find the albino bats living in the caves near here. Bring back several wings and I'll be forever in your debt.

npcs.name: Jumpa-Lope
utterances: Snort ...

npcs.name: Kaldin Deeppockets
utterances: I used to be one of the most famous brewmasters in Qeynos... till the gnolls burnt down me pub!
Pleased to meet you, I'd be, if circumstances weren't so dire.

npcs.name: Karg Icemoore
utterances: Welcome to Fish's Alehouse and Inn, finest brewhall in all of Qeynos -- no -- finest brewhall in all of Norrath!!  Belly up to Birney.  He'll get yer order.
Brell save me! Keep that book lowered. I don't need the Guard marchin' in and findin' me doing business with yer type.

npcs.name: Kashi Schoj
utterances: Psst ... I'm cutting you in on the deal of a lifetime.
I have to dump this stuff and move out tonight. Staying one step ahead of my, uh, happy customers.
Don't let these deals slip through your fingers.
Of course we deliver! I'll just need an address, key, and the times when you won't be home.

npcs.name: Kelia Spiritward
utterances: This river is beautiful, is it not?  I love watching the water flow through it.

npcs.name: Kell Silentfang
utterances: Yes <player name>, is there something I can help you with?

I am fully devoted to my home city of Qeynos, however apparently living a life of meditation and inner calm does not pay very well. In order to keep the life I am accustomed to I must adapt to such a life that I can pay for the roof over my head and floor beneath my feet.
I am not a violent person but I do consider myself to be a protective person. If I can fill that role with you and make some extra coin on the side it could be advantageous for the both of us!

npcs.name: Khai Lightfall
utterances: May yourr life be uneventful frriend.

npcs.name: Kizmit
utterances: Greetings, would you like to open an account or is there something else I can help with?

npcs.name: Kwa Stalwart
utterances: Hath Marr forsaken us?!  What plagues will befall our great city next?!
Use care when forming your next words, lest ye may find speaking without a tongue challenging!
Were you behind this?  A criminal returning to the scene, ye are!
I must purge the city of your ilk!
Thank ye!  I am recovered now, my brave friend.
I will not.  I... I am unsure of what had taken over my mind.  I felt such a burning... rage.  Oh!
I must have been affected by the warfare fever malady afflicting the citizens of Graystone Yard.  It was a blessing that I had not tarried in there for long, lest the rage taken a permanent root.
Marr be praised!  Yes.  Inform her of the warfare fever within Graystone Yard.

npcs.name: Kyla Pursglove
utterances: To attack from the shadows is the greatest of advantages.  An enemy cannot defend against an attack it can never see.

npcs.name: Kyren Darkcloud
utterances: Hail and good day to you, <player name>!
What more enriching life is there? Adventure around every corner and I get to be paid for my services, no matter what the Qeynos guard might say!
Oh, tis' but a footnote in my story, good friend! Tis' amazing what they consider "against the rules"! I assure you, if you pay me well, no such troubles may arise.
Together, we shall emblazon our names across legend and gain more fame than the very gods themselves!

npcs.name: Kyth
utterances: How goes it, <player name>?

npcs.name: Lambent
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!

npcs.name: Leila Fleetfoot
utterances: Just a nipper before I head home!

npcs.name: Lerad Boilfist
utterances: These walls won't fix themselves!  If you don't have business with me, then you'd best be on your way.

npcs.name: Lieoonlioo Croosinian
utterances: Well met, <player name>.  What brings you to the Elddar Grove this fine day?

npcs.name: Linst Tincobble
utterances: Why 'ello there!  Have you a little something for me?
Has nothing to do with time.  I was bound to catch her eye what with my new beard growing.  I knew she couldn't resist it!
Happy Frostfell!
Yes?
Oh, my!  Thank you!
I hope you enjoy the season!
Oh, my!  This is perfect!

npcs.name: a local patron
utterances: The time for ego must be set aside.  Your faith in a higher power will preserve you in the times ahead.
If we focus on the higher truths that govern our actions, we fathom the underlying power within them.
Nothing like sea breeze and a mug of ale in your hand!
Cheers!
Sometime ale tastes better outdoor don't you think?
I don't care what they say. I have a lovely singing voice.
I'm trying to find a new seasoning for my dried fish.
You won't see me near any of those fountains.
Will you quit pestering me?  Don't force me to summon the guards!
Hail, pleasure to meet you.
Get on now!  There's plenty of work to be done.  Maybe you should lend a hand, if you feel up to it.
Nostalgia isn't what it used to be.

npcs.name: Logan Camerus
utterances: Queen Antonia is watching over you.

npcs.name: Lyricist Kuehja
utterances: Within an era not found, but lost. We students of discord were shunned and tossed. Tossed from halls, taverns and boats. Those once considered ilk refuse to honor our chaotic notes.
Shun the chaos and shun the growth. Ignore us and perfect insanity will be ours to boast.
Gathering lutes and gathering flutes. Pick up your pace we're off to a musical roost.
Long long ago where wordly harmony became a grove. That's where they met and danced in the musical webs we wove.
Finally, the Chaos Orchestra has reformed to bring you fine people fine song.

npcs.name: Lyricist Trucci
utterances: Ladies and lords, Ro has frozen over. The Chaos Orchestra has returned to Norrath!
Now, gnoll, you howl a pretty good tune, but let's make a deal that can give you a magic lute or give this demon his due.

npcs.name: Lyssia Faren-Delnara
utterances: Ring human?  Who could that be?

We couldn't have chosen a more appropriate Ayr'Dal role model for our daughter.  Thank you!  Your actions have spoken much louder than our words on the subject ever could.  We are so grateful for your help!
We couldn't have chosen a more appropriate Ayr'Dal role model for our daughter.  Thank you!
May the gods watch over you this day.

npcs.name: Lyssia Faren-Delnara
utterances: Ring human?  Who could that be?

We couldn't have chosen a more appropriate Ayr'Dal role model for our daughter.  Thank you!  Your actions have spoken much louder than our words on the subject ever could.  We are so grateful for your help!
We couldn't have chosen a more appropriate Ayr'Dal role model for our daughter.  Thank you!

npcs.name: Madam Istynia
utterances: Blast it! Who keeps taking all of the parchment?
Be careful, it's best not to read the scrolls.  If you want to know what they are, just ask me.
Ah, a student of the arcane.  Is there something I can help you find?
All right where is my pen?  How am I supposed to scribe anything without my pen?

npcs.name: Marius Ironflint
utterances: Good day to you citizen.  If you've got any of that armor from ol' Ian here, I'd be happy to offer ya some of the newer stuff.

npcs.name: Markus
utterances: Please feel free to look around and make use of the equipment.
My items are only available for members in good standing with the Ironforge Exchange.

npcs.name: Marshal Surefoot
utterances: Stand stout! You'd make a fine deputy.
Aha!  A mercenary!  I can use your mettle for testing the strengths of the enemy.  Can you overcome the titans of the forest?  What do ya say, soldier?
Then stand firm and venture to the Forest Ruins.  The foes act as Forgotten Guardians.  They prey upon the people ... stand tall, soldier!  Crush a few and return with a tale of victory!
Good! Return when you've bested them.
What bravery!  You laughed in the face of death! You are a true protector of the forest realms.  I shall seek you out when I recruit my force of Leatherfoot deputies.  You are relieved for now.

npcs.name: Marv Boilfist
utterances: We need to help the residents of Baubbleshire however we can!

npcs.name: Mary Dillon
utterances: Just leave me alone. Please!
What?

npcs.name: Master Archer Nightbow
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?
What is it you need, traveler?
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!

npcs.name: Master Rysian Gladewalker
utterances: Hello, <player name>. I have heard a good bit about your skills. More specifically your talents in rescuing Gelerth. He has been a bit of a community project within the Tunarian Alliance. We will make a fine scout out of him yet! I wonder if you would mind taking on the task we originally gave to him?

Good, I like your attitude. He was tracking down a thief who had stolen some goods that were intended for the dockworkers in Qeynos Harbor. The dockmaster has stated that if they don't get those supplies soon they will fall horribly behind on their deadlines.

I'm afraid it's a bit more complicated than that. This thief is a crafty one. He has hidden the supplies very well. You will need to first track him down, then follow him to where he has stashed the supplies. If he sees you he will not go anywhere near the supplies.
Yes. However, once you know where the supplies are you have full authority to make sure he  never steals again.
I'm sure you can be creative.
Take them to the dockworkers in Qeynos Harbor.
Welcome back, <player name>. How did it go?
Oh, you met him? I know exactly who you are talking about.
Excellent. Well, I'm afraid I am a bit out of tasks at the moment.
No, its a bit tough to find the time to get him good training with all the side projects our group is doing. Why do you ask?
Blessed Tunare, that would be outstanding!
He just needs a crash course in the basics. Ranged attacks, stealth, and combat.
I think last I saw, he was hanging out at the archery range just watching the archers.
Welcome back, <player name>. How did the lessons go?
I can't say how impressed I am with you. In fact, I am going to assign you to a very important task. A task that is in need of someone just like you.

I'm afraid I can't really go into details right now. Instead, I am going to send you to  the head of our assassin guild for details. Her name is Daylia and she can be found just outside this building here in Elddar Grove. She will fill you in with the rest of the mission details.
Welcome back, <player name>. I heard of your battle with the assassin. The city is in your debt. You  have proven yourself time and time again. We are blessed to have you on our side.
Be well, <player name>. There may come a time where we or your city needs you again.

npcs.name: Master Scribe Phonetia
utterances: There is no language that is too hard to understand.
Have a local dialect you need to learn? I have got you covered!
I will have you learn a new language in no time!

npcs.name: Mav Boilfist
utterances: Sorry, I'm terribly busy right now. No time to chat.

npcs.name: a medic
utterances: Oh, hello there!  You must be who I was sent to meet.
He was called away.  He has a great many demands upon his time.  He left me here to provide you with the salve you desire.
And here is the salve that you were promised.  Be sure to put it on as many wounded as possible!

npcs.name: Mervos Stadrin
utterances: Hello, traveler!  How I envy you.  What I wouldn't give to journey the world as I did in my youth.   Alas, my days of adventuring are long past, but at least I can occupy myself with my various trinkets and collections that I picked up in my travels.
This is a magnificent find! Here, take this for all your hard work.

Why, any sort of collection. There's so much out there to  find! Just open your eyes and peek under the rocks.  If you find anything interesting, let me have a look. Collecting is the only way I seem to relive my youth!

npcs.name: Messenger Tibeld
utterances: Let me see... no... nope, I don't have anything for you right now.  Perhaps another time.

npcs.name: Milo Faren
utterances: <player name>, you have returned to us!  Speak to me friend, what did you find in the Forest Ruins?
The pirates were behind it?!
What?!  A Qeynosian may have had a hand in the attack?  Such behavior is expected in Freeport, not here!
You are a credit to all Ayr'Dal, and all Qeynosians, everywhere!
When you find the gnoll tunneling site within the Forest Ruins, shut it down.  If we're lucky, you'll also learn of their accomplices.

npcs.name: Minda Broadfeet
utterances: I have goods here; general goods. Bags, bread and more.

npcs.name: Mirthmire
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: Molly Daysun
utterances: Stop, Kitty!  Come back here!

npcs.name: a monk initiate
utterances: Ah, what have we here? Glad to see you endured the journey here, adventurer.
I'm confident that the merchants of our city will fill all equipment needs with the utmost hospitality.

npcs.name: Murrar Shar
utterances: Ah, <player name>.  I'm glad you have come.  I've been waiting for you.
I have been well, thank you.  And I'm glad to see you doing well, too.  Welcome to Qeynos, city of light, and the beacon of hope on Norrath.
Indeed there has.  Queen Antonia has ordered some work done throughout Qeynos, primarily to address issues such as aging structures and basic improvements.

The Queen has paid for this largely from her own coffers.  She has petitioned the Circle of Ten for more support, as there is more work that needs to be done, especially to improve the battlements and harbors.  Unfortunately, not everyone agrees with her that the work is necessary.

Indeed she could, but Queen Antonia believes in the rule of Law, and prefers to act within civil guidelines whenever possible.  She will only assert her sovereign right when she feels it is critical to the safety of Qeynos and its citizens.

Ah, perhaps you heard about our involvement with the New Combine?  That was entirely Queen Antonia's decision.  She did not consult the Circle of Ten when she agreed to Lucan's terms and joined the alliance.

Overall, the Queen enjoys the support of the people of Qeynos, and does what she can to help them, even through tough times such as these.  Sometimes her decisions can lead to discontent, which is something she accepts.  Perhaps, though, you would be best served to see how she is received yourself.
Speak with a few of the people around the city.  Here, I'll give you the names of a few.  See what they have to say, then come back to me.
Ah, welcome back, <player name>.  How did your discussions go?

Indeed there are, which is why I wanted you to speak with those three.  I've heard many people talk about the Queen and Qeynos, and I can certainly understand how those citizens come to believe as they do.  But those who say that the Queen isn't trying to help the city are wrong - she works tirelessly to help out all of Qeynos.

Queen Antonia does whatever she can to help.  Unfortunately, each of the situations in the neighborhoods is unique, and is something that would require the full attention of the guard all by themselves.  Having all of these issues coming up all at once is disturbing... for a few reasons.

Perhaps.  If you'd like, why don't you meet with Harkam Nubbytoe down near the Baubbleshire?  He is looking to help refugees from there that have been driven out of their homes.  See if there's something you can do for him.

Welcome back!  If you haven't yet, I suggest that you speak with Kwipp Stalwart.  Oh, and Harkam Nubbytoe said that his friend still needed help, although he wouldn't go into any other detail... you might want to look into that.

npcs.name: Musician Zwena
utterances: Perhaps I could entertain you with a song?

npcs.name: Nalon Messpie
utterances: Just want you to know I had nothing to do with that barstool collapsing underneath you the other day.  Honest!
So, do you look at a tankard and consider it half full?  Or half empty?

npcs.name: Nathan Ironforge
utterances: Have you been inside the castle? I want to go there someday!
Have you seen a Gnoll before?
I want to join the Qeynos Guard when I grow up!

npcs.name: Naturalist Tummyfill
utterances: Hello again, my friend.  It seems that things are worse than they appear. We need to deliver the fight directly to our enemies.  Go speak to Shepherd Sell'ar when you have a chance.  He'll fill you in on the details.

npcs.name: Nelis Greenpocket
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: a Nights of the Dead celebrator
utterances: Buck up, adventure seeker!  This be a time for celebratin'!
The Nights of the Dead are here!  So many frights, decorations and illusions.  So many changing faces!  Because you know, we haven't always enjoyed such a frivolous night of beasts and masks.
Too true, mighty one!  But it is on these nights that instead we enjoy midnight banquets and parades of costumes in observation of the undead assault upon the streets of Maj'Dul.
Relax and enjoy the treats, excitable one, for the attack upon Maj'Dul happened long ago in the early days of the Age of Destiny.

A story that leaves more questions than answers.  'Twas a clear and still night in the desert.  A shambling army of undead inundated the city of Maj'Dul.  The city hid themselves from the walking dead, for fear of what this force was there to do.  Kill?  Kidnap?  Desecrate?  Feed?  And those that did not huddle in fear battled the innumerable undead to defend their city.

Quite different!  The citizens soon took notice that the decaying bodies were not harming anyone, except for those that stood in their way.  The ghastly figures would break down doors, and rummage through all of a person's possessions, smashing anything open that was otherwise latched or sealed.

This was to last a week, when as mysteriously as they came, they departed.  They turned in mid action, and shuffled back to the sands from which they came, as if answering a ghoulish cry.  The people of Maj'Dul never learned what it was that the undead were looking for, nor what they finally found.  But we commemorate that week of monsters and frights in search of goodies in old Maj'Dul with our own week of beasts and treats.
Be on the lookout for ghouls and ghoulies, my friend!

npcs.name: Oakhall
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Olvene Kettershot
utterances: Why hello!  Welcome to Qeynos!  So glad to meet you!
And why wouldn't I be?  I've got a good life, and a good home.  Sure, there are problems around, but the Queen will fix them - I'm sure of it!

What do you mean?  She cares about this city like no one else.  She works hard to make sure that we are safe, and in her time as queen, has made some hard decisions.  I wouldn't want to be in her shoes, that's for sure!
Oh, most certainly!  She's done a fabulous job of looking after Qeynos, and I'm sure she will continue to do so for years to come!

npcs.name: an onlooker
utterances: The more the merrier, I always say.
Will you quit pestering me?  Don't force me to summon the guards!
Welcome...welcome traveler, to the fair city of Qeynos! My, isn't it a magnificent day?
How sweet my Tom is to leave such a gift at my door step.
It's a good day for a drink. Just like every other day.

npcs.name: Paavali Dewshine
utterances: 'Tis a glorious day, wouldn -- Pardon my curiosity... is that a tattoo I see poking out from your armor?
Oh!  I am an admirer of the art that I see some have placed upon their bodies.  Many of my saplings look down upon such "impurity" upon a body, but I think it rather grand.
Happy Frostfell!
Good day!
Mother Tunare, how nice of you!
Thank you.

npcs.name: a pacified Qeynos resident
utterances: We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin shines so bright...
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.

npcs.name: Palla Jhal
utterances: True beauty has no age.

npcs.name: Patrolman Edward
utterances: Ah, what have we here? Glad to see you endured the journey here, adventurer.
Welcome to Qeynos, friend.

npcs.name: Pearl Honeywine
utterances: I wonder whether they've simply been here all along and we didn't see them?  Or is there some new way these creatures are reaching civilization?  The possibilities are endless and interesting!
My apologies! I was lost in thought for a moment.  The return of the roekilliks has taken me and my colleagues quite by surprise.  They are such an ancient race; this is very exciting information!

Some people call them "ratmen" which is descriptive but not very useful to social anthropologists such as myself.  Some say they're ancestral relatives of the ratonga, but no ratonga will confirm this for me.  I've been thinking of what might have brought the roekillik into the open.  They've resisted my attempts to interview them.

They're practically legendary creatures!  This is an anthropologist's dream: to find they still exist! Yet it seems they are unwilling to be "studied" by me.  I need to find another way to get information about them.

npcs.name: Pelle Shinkicker
utterances: Oh, what is it now?  Bristlebane's no doubt playing tricks on me again, causing all this interruption!  Is there something meaningful I can help you with, or are you just going to gawk?

npcs.name: Phen Domlinson
utterances: Fresh supplies every week! Step up and see for yourself.

npcs.name: Pinchy Presentpeeler
utterances: Golly, I'm so glad you showed up, <player name>. Hopefully, you can save our leader and our home. We are starting to get real sad.

We need you because our leader, Lord Bowsprite, has disappeared and our home has been taken over! We have no idea what to do without his strong leadership. He is the most honorable, noblest of elves. He takes care of all of us, tells us what to do when we are sad, or confused and he makes us laugh. He is the bestest leader, ever! With the meanie pants green fella living in our home and Lord Bowsprite missing we have no clue what to do!

We know for sure it was those mean goblins, but we don't know where they took him or why. The greenie goblin that took over our home just showed up the other day. We tried to hug him, but he got really cross and yelled at us. Then our home suddenly became downright freezing and there are all these strange monsters roaming around. We all got very, very scared. We think maybe that mean old goblin brought them. We need Lord Bowsprite to tell us what to do.

We don't know. There are so many tribes of them, the Fubbyfuzzers, the Hammyhousers, the Runnyeyes, the Snickysniffers, the Pickclaws, the Gigglegibbers, the Swammyswimmers... I just don't know. The only clue I have is the greenie that has taken over our land kept talking about making gold and strange schemes. He wasn't very smart neither.

Let me think... He said something like, "Spinning numbers, spin real fast, they lose lots of moneys and then they gasp. Gold, silver, platinum please, if you win then we sneeze." We thought it was the silliest song. It made us all laugh real hard, so we started singing it with him and dancing around, but I think it made him madder. Greenie gobbys are so weird.
Hurry quick and let us know when you find our beloved Lord Bowsprite.

npcs.name: Porter
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Pottsby
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: a practicing contender
utterances: Me and my friends have all agreed to be non-conformists.
I'm only happy when it rains.  Well.. I like sunny days too.  Okay... I'm actually happy all the time.
I'm so depressed!  I had to work all day!
As soon as I get my own boat, I'm outta here!
I've seen it all. Now I just want to relax in the comfort of the city.
It's good to always have a sharp axe and a full belly.
Ale may be the life's blood, but fighting is the soul of my existence!

npcs.name: Preservationist Reynolds
utterances: Many thanks to you and your guild for your continued efforts.
I haven't heard anything from the last scout party.  They're a tough bunch. I hope they're all right.

npcs.name: Proprietor Blagard
utterances: Step right up and peruse the antiquities, my friend.  Never has coin been better spent.
You'd be wise to forget about that coin. It'll lead you to nothing but trouble and a one-way ticket to the tower of Ethernere.
My associates said you'd be persistent. They instructed me to tell you that if you ever procure another coin, they'll be waiting for you beyond the hand in the Down Below.
I prefer to keep my supply of rarities flowing, so I'll keep my mouth shut about that. As far as I know, you might be a mole of Constable Arathur.
You again! I see the Hand has made use of you rather than making a training dummy outta you. Now, shove off before the guards come waltzing over to see what all the hush hush is about.

npcs.name: a Qeynos citizen
