utterances: Have you seen them?  I've heard that ratonga have been spotted in the city!
Are they here as spies?  Are they planning an attack?
Argh, it's not enough that they filthy up Freeport, now they've come here to spread their disease and muck around our city?  PAH!

npcs.name: a Qeynos monk
utterances: One's intelligence must follow faith, never precede it, and never destroy it.
Breath is the bridge that connects life to consciousness, which unites your body to your thoughts.

npcs.name: a Qeynos monk
utterances: One's intelligence must follow faith, never precede it, and never destroy it.
Breath is the bridge that connects life to consciousness, which unites your body to your thoughts.

npcs.name: a Qeynos resident
utterances: I'm itching for a good fight!  Are those goblins back yet?
Warm days like this remind me of my old traveling days.
Well met, traveler. Has your journey to our village been a troublesome one?
It's been a long day.  I could use an ale or six.
Hail, noble. It is with jubilation that I while away this time speaking with you.
It brings comfort to my heart to see you come to us in safety.
Patience they say, is a virtue.  It has taken a lot of patience to rebuild our lives so far from home.
The greatest enemy a community can face is hubris.  Always remember, we must work together for peace.
I never thought it would be so difficult to carry on.  I have no songs left in my heart.
As with all relationships in life sometimes desire can lead to misfortune.  I strive to temper love and discipline.
We must remain steady against the influence of evil.  Only with perseverance will Qeynos survive!
So much blood and so many lost.  I never believed it would end this way.
The city is nice, but It feels a bit chilly up here.
Oh! You snuck up on me. Good to see you.
I still dream of the good old days, digging up gems and gold.
Remember to be brave while adventuring.  The brave are most handsomely rewarded.
Keep up your good work.  I can tell, you got character.
I've found that the right amount of patience and enthusiasm can open almost any door.
Ah, it brings me happiness to see so many newcomers arriving to the exalted city of Qeynos.
The more the merrier, I always say.
Where are you going?  It's impolite to go off and fight without inviting me!
I only dream of short days and long nights in the tavern.
The winds carry voices of powerful foes and dragons of unimaginable strength and magic.
Hail and welcome, I do hope your stay here is uplifting.

npcs.name: a Qeynos resident
utterances: I'm itching for a good fight!  Are those goblins back yet?
Warm days like this remind me of my old traveling days.
Well met, traveler. Has your journey to our village been a troublesome one?
It's been a long day.  I could use an ale or six.
Hail, noble. It is with jubilation that I while away this time speaking with you.
It brings comfort to my heart to see you come to us in safety.
Patience they say, is a virtue.  It has taken a lot of patience to rebuild our lives so far from home.
The greatest enemy a community can face is hubris.  Always remember, we must work together for peace.
I never thought it would be so difficult to carry on.  I have no songs left in my heart.
As with all relationships in life sometimes desire can lead to misfortune.  I strive to temper love and discipline.
We must remain steady against the influence of evil.  Only with perseverance will Qeynos survive!
So much blood and so many lost.  I never believed it would end this way.
The city is nice, but It feels a bit chilly up here.
Oh! You snuck up on me. Good to see you.
I still dream of the good old days, digging up gems and gold.
Remember to be brave while adventuring.  The brave are most handsomely rewarded.
Keep up your good work.  I can tell, you got character.
I've found that the right amount of patience and enthusiasm can open almost any door.

npcs.name: Rabbleson
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!

npcs.name: Randal Gromoe
utterances: It's been a while since I've felt this carefree.

npcs.name: Rask Helstot
utterances: Welcome to the Elddar grove, young one.  Enjoy the shelter which the trees provide.
Though it's the only remaining tree of its kind, the Elddar grows ever larger.  Perhaps a symbol of Qeynos and her people even more fitting than the Claymore itself.

I don't believe I've met you before, young one.  I should introduce myself.  I am Rask Helstot, a druid, and one of the last followers of Karana you're likely to meet!  If you're amiable to a task, I wouldn't mind finding out what you're made of.  I could use someone to investigate some things for me, but I need to be certain you're up to the challenge.

Of late, two groups have been exposed that could hinder the growth of our fair city.  On the one hand, we've got the wild and savage gnolls.  Filthy and wild, they prey on the weak and unprepared.  On the other, the Bloodsabers have been said to be stalking the outskirts of the city, and perhaps even have agents in the catacombs.  If you were to choose one evil to fight, which would it be?

Very good!  If Fippy had not returned to a wilder state after his adventuring days, I'm certain the gnolls habits would be much different.  Alas, that is neither a story for now, nor does it do much good to dwell on the past.  Perhaps some other time I can tell you that tale... For now though, prove your worth by killing ten of the beasts for me.

You did?  You don't look too much the worse for wear.  I suppose you're ready for a journey then.  Throughout the history of Norrath, the druids have held clandestine gatherings away from the eyes of others.  Many of these were held at the ancient druid stones, most of which have been lost now.  The circle closest to Qeynos has been blocked for an age untold, but I would like you to venture to it.

Against the far hills, north of the path leading to the Steppes, you will find a small trail leading into the mountains.  Stay alert, the area is besieged with bandits and worse.  The actual path itself is cleverly hidden, by my reckoning it lies just three to four hundred cogs north of the old Blackburrow entrance.  Return here when you've had a look at the pass.

npcs.name: Ratscallion Attamilgad
utterances: Cloakses! Get your cloakses, here!

npcs.name: Rebik Sprocketrock
utterances: Well met, good friend!  I'm  busy working on this new lock here!  I think it'll be unpickable once I'm done!

npcs.name: a reclusive monk
utterances: This is the spot I will stay and no longer shall the Graystone Guild disturb my peace.
Please leave me be. I need to be in the absolute state of tranquility.
One important element of our training is to reach inner peace with our mind and soul. This however, has been most difficult task since the arrival of the Graystone Guild...

npcs.name: a relieved Qeynos resident
utterances: I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin shines so bright...
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
May the gods continue to bless us.
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!

npcs.name: Renee Atherton
utterances: I bet you have some stories, eh?  Adventuring must be an exciting life!

npcs.name: Rinna
utterances: I wonder what Qeynos will be like years from now.  This city has seen its fair share of changes, that is for certain.
Are you hurt?  Is there something you need?  Please rest here, and I will tend to you as soon as I can.  Just give me a few moments...
Oh!  Oh, thank goodness.  That is a relief... there is so much to do here, and any help I can get is very appreciated.

Indeed, and they need our help badly.  They've been pushed from their homes, many are injured, and all are hungry.  I've been doing what I can to tend to their needs, but we keep getting new arrivals from the neighborhood, and I am hard-pressed to get to them all...
Oh, thank you, thank you!  I need to get them some medical supplies and some food quickly.  Can you collect some supplies from those crates and distribute them?
Oh, I'm sorry - I didn't see you come up.  How did it go?

Yes... I know.  We are dreadfully short on supplies here.  I had expected to get more, but there haven't been any forthcoming.  It's frustrating, but I don't have the time to spare to go and see what the hold up is.

The Ironforge Exchange was supposed to send them over.  I know some requisition lists were sent to them, and that they were supposed to send back the supplies once those were received, but we haven't heard anything back here.
Speak with Accountant Melet.  She's in the Ironforge Exchange building near the palace.
Oh, hello again, my friend.  Did you find out what happened to those requisition lists?
Wait... stolen??  Did you get them back?  What happened?
Oh!  Well... I'm... I'm sure she just didn't know yet.  But you got them back, right?
Wait, there's not enough food?
Oh no... this is bad.  We need that food.  I need to get out to the farms and figure out what is keeping them...
I know, but we need to ration food as it is already.  If we don't have enough, then these poor citizens won't get enough to eat.
Oh, thank you!  You are too kind.  Yes, let me know what they say, and if there's anything I can do to help.
Oh!  You're back!  And just in time, too - people here are getting hungry.  Did you find what happened to the food?
Wait... not good?  What happened?
That's... that's preposterous!  How do they not have their payment??
HASN'T RECEIVED... what??  That's impossible!  Of course they have authorization!
Is that so?  Okay... well... I have an idea, if you're willing to help.

Antonia's courier is a fae by the name of Laventy.  About this time of day, Laventy should be near the city offices in the Capitol District.  Head down that way, and see if perhaps you can find out what became of the authorization.
Oh good, I've been waiting for you.  Did you find Laventy?
Oh, really?  What happened?
Really?  That seems... strange.  What happened then?
You... you were attacked?  I'm... I'm so very sorry.  I'm glad you weren't hurt, at least.  You've helped out a lot, <player name>.
We need to find out what happened with the clerk you were working with.  I think you were indeed set up to be silenced, and we need to know why.

Now, I understand that you'd want to even the score a bit with that clerk, but please, remember that Qeynos is a city with laws.  No one here is above those laws, so please go to the guard if you need help.
Ah, you've returned.  Hopefully you were able to speak to the clerk and reach a peaceful agreement?
Oh, no - you were jumped again?
I... I see.  Did you find out anything?
This... this is the seal of the Ironforge family!  Are they really tangled up with the Bloodsabers somehow?
This is incredible... but we must allow the law to take over in this case.  I need to take this down to the guard and have them see what is going on...

That is a good idea.  The food has just gotten here, so I'll make sure it is being distributed properly.  Come back to me once you've talked to the guard - speak with Investigator Keklem in the guard.  He should be able to help with something like this.

npcs.name: Robert Newbury
utterances: I'll take care of your coin and goods if they need safekeeping.

npcs.name: Rosalina Goodfallow
utterances: I often see to our Antonia's business outside of the castle. She trusts me implicitly.
<player name>, Queen Antonia wishes to see you. She says it is of the utmost importance!

I haven't a clue! She didn't say why, and I didn't think it my place to ask, either. I'm sure she'll tell you though! Just walk straight on up to the doors of the castle in North Qeynos. You've been permitted entry.

npcs.name: Rothun
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Rupert Valorbound
utterances: For Valor and Love, my friend!

npcs.name: Sarbith Plegnog
utterances: Isn't the Ak'Anon Clock beautiful!  Certainly it should be admired for its genius and complexity.

npcs.name: Scout of Discord
utterances: I am here to sow the seeds of discord. Chaos and death!

npcs.name: a scout trainee
utterances: The destructive methods of the Qeynos Guard will ravage that which it seeks to defend.

npcs.name: Sean Wellfayer
utterances: I don't think fishing interests you. Perhaps you should be on your way.
If fishing doesn't interest you, perhaps bait does!
Please, try your luck. I've been fishing here since I was a small boy, and I still have great luck hooking fish.

npcs.name: Senior Initiate Delvin
utterances: It must be my lucky day to run into you here.
I'm honored to make your acquaintance!  My home is your home, should you ever need a place to rest.
I've met and made many friends here in Qeynos, and so shall you.

npcs.name: Senior Initiate Karuda
utterances: I still feel shame over my defeat.  However, through that defeat, I have learned much about how far even I have to go in my discipline.

npcs.name: Sergeant Delve
utterances: I wonder what Qeynos will be like years from now.  This city has seen its fair share of changes, that is for certain.

npcs.name: Shakan Notebend
utterances: Well met, <player name>.  What brings you to the Elddar Grove this fine day?

npcs.name: Sheldon Lamport
utterances: All right where is my pen?  How am I supposed to scribe anything without my pen?

npcs.name: Shepherd Sell'ar
utterances: Thank you and thank you for your continued selfless service to Tunare and her followers.  I'm afraid that your service to the city has become invaluable. You need to speak to Preservationist Reynolds.  She can direct you in what we'll need for the time ahead.  Good luck.

npcs.name: Shiharra Veldin
utterances: The adventurers of Norrath have proven themselves as heroes among heroes, and through their actions they have helped change the course of our history itself.  However, in order to perform these deeds, they must constantly test themselves, and find strength where they were unaware that it existed.  Through our chronomancy, we can help you find that strength.

We can set you back to a time in your life when your strength was still growing.  A time of learning the bounds of your abilities, of your skill, of your courage.  In doing this, you may find you've always possessed strength you were unaware existed, and conquer enemies that once would have proven deadly.

npcs.name: Shiningleaf
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Shireen Faren-Delnara
utterances: You're a very brave, Ayr'Dal.
Ayr'Dal are brave, even when we are scared.

npcs.name: Shireen Faren-Delnara
utterances: You're a very brave, Ayr'Dal.
Ayr'Dal are brave, even when we are scared.

npcs.name: Sinphinus
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!

npcs.name: Sir Aidan Godard
utterances: Before you stands the Hall of Steel.  Within these walls is the birthplace of the Steel Warriors, the greatest fighters in all of Norrath.

npcs.name: Smith Holgren
utterances: I just got a shipment in from the Far Sea's Trading Company.  I don't just show anybody this stuff so, shhhh!

npcs.name: Soldier of Discord
utterances: I am here to sow the seeds of discord. Chaos and death!

npcs.name: Sprockfuddle
utterances: I need a ledger to track what she skims from my profits!
There's a better life out there.  A much better life.
Stupid taxes!

npcs.name: Squire Moorford
utterances: Hello!  How can I help you? It's my proud duty to help keep this harbor safe!

npcs.name: Standar Yorden
utterances: Ah, a young acolyte looking for work.  You've come to the wrong place, or the right place.  Well, wrong and right.  I don't have work for you, but I know someone who does.  Bellengere the Three at the Concordium.  Now go hit your books!

npcs.name: Taburg
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Tacklemaster Moyna
utterances: The harbor here is great for fishing...when the boats aren't in that is!  What brings you out this way?  Taking a trip, or just enjoying the scenery?
You're in luck. I need more bait.  If you're interested, you could fetch me some centipede meat. Sean and Ashilda catch all the fish from the pier, and I always need more bait.

It'll pay but not too well.  The bait business is decent next to the pier, but the stuff isn't exactly worth its weight in platinum, if you know what I mean.  I need you to gather some centipede meat for me from the Forest Ruins.
What's taking you so long, friend? I don't have all day! Fetch me my centipedes!
How goes the centipede hunt?
Thank you!  With this supply, I can keep my bait buckets filled for at least another day or two. Well done. Here's your reward as promised.

npcs.name: Tairiel Oakshade
utterances: Hello adventurer! Are you here to serve the Tunarian Alliance? We find ourselves in need of some dedicated scouts who can help us with a few tasks.
Great! We are in need of someone with excellent ranged skills. Are you such a scout?

I'm glad you asked! We currently have an outstanding task that needs carrying out with the Baubbleshire. It seems the gnomes and halflings are doing fairly well against the portal creatures that have arrived there. However, they are struggling against certain creatures that are out of their reach.

Yes, yes, please do! Oh! While you are in there we got a request from the Concordium to grab samples of the portals within the zone. They are working on something in order to close the portals for good, but need fragments of them for their testing. If you bring them back to me I can get them into the right hands.
Make sure to get fragments of the portals appearing in Baubbleshire while you are taking out the creatures around the skies.
I see you've returned, how did it go?
Outstanding work! I'm actually glad you came back when you did. We got a rather urgent  report that we need someone to act on immediately.

The residents of Nettleville have reported that the Circle of Ten have been setting traps in and around their homes in an attempt to catch blood crazed freeblood. The problem is the  traps cannot tell between a blood crazed freeblood and a normal innocent citizen.
No, actually, I believe there are other organizations working on that front. We need to protect the people in other ways.

Well, the whole situation with the Circle of Ten is a touchy one. If we go in there and just destroy the traps, it will look like an act of aggression against the Circle of Ten, and thats the last thing we need right now.

I assume you are well versed in disarming traps... So, go in and disarm them, then tamper with the trigger pin so they do not go off. The Circle of Ten will just assume they are a bad batch of traps and hopefully abandon the use of them altogether.
Yes, indeed they do. They are just as dangerous as the traps are to the citizens. If you run into any of them make sure to dispose of them.
Did you take care of those traps? You didn't get caught did you?
Good point! Are you ready for something else? It just so happens I have another task here that needs done and I think you have the skills needed for this.

While you were gone I gave a task to one of our less skilled scouts, Gelerth Bucklebrow.  It was just a routine supply retrieval from a thief in the Graystone Yard. I'm afraid he hasn't checked in, and knowing his skill level, I'm afraid something may have happened to him.  How are your skills with tracking?

Good to hear. You will likely need those skills in order to find him. There is quite a brawl that seems to be happening in the Graystone Yard at the moment. In fact, I hear the Qeynos Guard has had quite a time of getting them under control.
Yes, they do. Your primary goal there is to find Gelerth but if you see a brawl breaking out feel free to teach them a lesson!
Return to me once you have him safe.
Is Gelerth safe?
Excellent. I commend you on your actions. I'm not sure he would have lasted long in that situation. Luckily you were around to save him.

Oh yes, we plan to get him trained up a bit more before sending him anywhere else.  Speaking of training, I'm afraid there is no more that I can teach you as your skill level might even rival my own. In fact, I am fairly certain your skill level rivals my own. I would like you to go and speak to one of the masters of our order, Master Rysian Gladewalker.
He can be found within the Arbos the Elddar Tree. You will need to take the lift up to  the top.

npcs.name: Takk
utterances: This is a good spot for meditation, and for listening to the spirits speak.

npcs.name: Tala McMorgan
utterances: Coin is no object when gaining protection from your enemies.  What price can be put on your safety?
You can never be too careful when it comes to protection.  Here, try on one of these.

npcs.name: Telandra
utterances: You could not know what it is to lose your home.  I know you try, but you cannot know.
I don't understand the need for piercings, but they look fine on you.
To be among the highest leaves and branches of a tree is to feel free.

npcs.name: Telgard
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Thabit Kalila
utterances: Salutations.  You are lucky you caught me during a momentary distraction from my studies.  Else I would not be so accommodating.
Painfully.  A wretched Halfling went bumbling by.  She looked so foolish, and reminded me of a friend long gone.  How I miss her companionship, our talks over her homemade pie.  Anyway...
Enjoy the festivities!
Hello, again!
I did not require anything.

npcs.name: Thomas Dedry
utterances: I doeshn't talk with *hic* shhhtrangershh!

npcs.name: Timeless Chronomage
utterances: Greetings! Would you like me to chronolock you? For a small fee of course...

npcs.name: Tom Sterling
utterances: Nothing like drowning your troubles at the end of a long day!

npcs.name: a training strider
utterances: The destructive methods of the Qeynos Guard will ravage that which it seeks to defend.

npcs.name: Traylo Leafsway
utterances: Greetings citizen.  Please see me if you have any armor from Gildas that you wish to be rid of, I have some newer armor that may interest you.

npcs.name: Trelly Greenthorn
utterances: Thankfully, it's still peaceful here in the Province District, but the same can't be said for my home within the Willow Wood.
Please, leave me...
I'm sorry.  I'm just...distraught.  There's nothing you can do.
I see you won't give up.  I'm Trelly Greenthorn.
It's my brother, Jendan.  He died in The Willow Wood when the gnolls invaded.
Thank you.  I just don't know what else to do now.  I have no other relatives here in Qeynos.  I should probably just go back to Kelethin...
Yes, but I can't just leave now, not without at least burying my only brother.  I just can't get that last image out of my mind, of him yelling for me to run as the gnolls surrounded him...
Yes, but that was days ago.  And there were so many gnolls.  The look in his eyes when he told me to run...then they swarmed him...
If this was just today, then maybe...but, I don't know...and the Qeynos Guard around here don't know a thing and are too busy keeping the gnolls from penetrating into the Province District!
A lot like me, actually.  He's a ranger for the Tunarian Alliance, so wears the garb of one attuned with the forest...why?
Oh thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!
Yes.  He's in fine health too!  You were right, don't ever count us Feir'Dal out.
He wanted to apologize for leaving in such haste.  He had to bring word of what he discovered in The Willow Wood back to the Tunarian Alliance.
You're poisoned!  It's probably gnoll-make.  I better cure it fast before it takes you entirely!
Oh thank Tunare you're awake!
What do you mean?
Probably the effect of the gnoll poison.  It was quite severe.  My cure-all failed miserably so I had you brought here to the Tunarian Alliance, but we still had trouble curing you.
It was strange.  You spoke in your sleep at times, but only to tell me the name of an herb.
Yes!  I don't know what happened, but you gave me the right ingredients.  From there we were able to mix them properly and cure you.  The poison quickly subsided.
Don't thank me.  It was you who led me to the cure.  Oh!  Jendan has some news about the gnolls you might want to hear.  He's just inside the arbor here.
Actually no, I'll be heading back near The Willow Wood helping any injured soldiers.  If you need anything else you'll find me there.
I hope you're able to help Jendan with whatever he has for you.
I'd like to know what happened to him, so thank you, <player name>, whatever you find out.
<player name>?  You're starting to look as pale as a Koada'Dal!
Focus on me, <player name>...
It's a travesty what has become of The Willow Wood.

npcs.name: Trillium
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: a Tunarian scout
utterances: I fear that the Concordium is unable to control its disciples. If corrupted the sorcerers would surely bring harm to the woodlands and their creatures.
While the land suffers and cries out for immediate protection the Celestial Watch is content to look to myths and superstitions for our salvation.
The destructive methods of the Qeynos Guard will ravage that which it seeks to defend.
The Tunarian Alliance preserves our memories of the breathing trees and singing streams of Jaggedpine.
The mechanical beasts of the Ironforge Exchange belch forth black clouds to choke out life within the forests.

npcs.name: Umli Grayfist
utterances: Have I got a bargain for you!  Come now, step up, I don't bite.  Check my goods and see if we can't make a whale of a deal! Ha ha ha ha ...Whale of a deal, get it?

npcs.name: Velnia
utterances: Ah, the lure of the sea.  How can anyone avoid the call to sail the sea's waters, to explore, to be free?

npcs.name: Velwich
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Vernon Tinworthy
utterances: What do you want?

npcs.name: a veteran pathfinder
utterances: The mechanical beasts of the Ironforge Exchange belch forth black clouds to choke out life within the forests.

npcs.name: Vida Sweeps
utterances: So much to do!  So little time! I must finish my sweeping, but I need a new broom. Perhaps you'll help me in return for a precious stone?
So much to do!  So little time!  I must get these tents in order, and all this sweeping is giving me blisters.  It wouldn't be so bad if there weren't all these little rocks about.

These stones on the ground, of course ... I guess I swept away most of the pebbles, but I did keep one strange blue rock that I found in the dust.  If you agree to help me, I'll give you the precious stone as payment. Unfortunately, I'm short on coin.

npcs.name: a visiting traveler
utterances: Please, I am in the midst of solving a very complex problem and must not be interrupted.
I have learned that it is best to trust to your own wisdom rather than the weaponry of your acquaintances.

npcs.name: Wanderer Greencoast
utterances: Well, you've done incredibly well. You saved countless innocent lives with your selflessness. I think you're ready to help us in the battle out there.  Go speak with Naturalist Tummyfill near the treehouse, and he'll give you your next assignment.

npcs.name: Wanderer Raegen Truthshadow
utterances: You have exposed a great deal of information about the Overrealm that has proved to be invaluable. Many thanks to you and your guild for your continued efforts.

npcs.name: Warble Wildmane
utterances: Shh!  Old Treebark's talking!

Oh, sorry I forget most people can't talk to trees.  Treebark and I were discussing the merits of various soils.  I favor a rich Rivervale loam while tree bark here thinks New Antonican sod can't be beat.
Yea, I spent most of my time with the Heartwood tree until the Heartwood matron forbade it.  It needs help and I can't even approach it.  Could you try?
Take this pendant and find the Heartwood tree.  It's located in the center of this grove.  Once there clasp the pendant in one hand and touch the tree with the other.
Thank you!

npcs.name: Wesaelan Brookshadow
utterances: Hail traveler!  All friends of the Elddar are welcome.

I've uncovered the location of a tome hidden by Karana's  followers long before the gods left this world.  I recently discovered its location with the aid of Duvos.  My duties here do not permit the time to recover the tome. I can charge you with recovering this treasure - if you're capable of such an invaluable task.

You will need to venture to the great oak in the fields outside the city where the tome has been hidden for many decades. You must thoroughly search the tree. Remember, the tome has been missing for many years. Use care when handling this precious treasure.
Brigands!  How would they find the location of the tome? I don't believe mere bandits could achieve such a task. What did these fiends look like? Did they speak of anything peculiar?

Please, say it isn't so ... Could they be attempting to raise an ancient Bloodsaber leader? How would this tome aid them in this task? To my knowledge, the tome is only a written historical record. Indeed, this requires further investigation! You've served us well, good friend. Take this coin with my blessing.
I do thank you. I'm very glad you've returned, for I have an urgent matter to discuss with you. The Bloodsabers have been active. I know it's hard to believe, but the evidence cannot be denied.

According to the rumors, the more active members are lurking in the catacombs under the city. It's hard to find good help in the Down Below. We need you to penetrate the Vermin Snye and find out what the Bloodsabers' orders are. Can you do it?
Then go to the Snye and return to me with any information you can find on the Bloodsabers. We must put an end to this menace. We're counting on you, friend.

Take it to Captain Eitoa at once. The duty to stop this resurgence of the Bloodsabers has fallen on her shoulders. She's been watching their suspicious movements and will certainly welcome this piece of intelligence. The Bloodsabers will cease their scheming once and for all!

npcs.name: Willama
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: a Willow Wood defender
utterances: Thank you for the assistance, <player name>.

npcs.name: a wonderstruck Qeynos resident
utterances: Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
Luclin shines so bright...
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
May the gods continue to bless us.

npcs.name: Wyrmdon
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Yarwick
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Zara
utterances: All right where is my pen?  How am I supposed to scribe anything without my pen?
Be careful, it's best not to read the scrolls.  If you want to know what they are, just ask me.
Blast it! Who keeps taking all of the parchment?
